meanings.definition: A piece of wood, metal, or other material having one thick end and tapering to a thin edge, driven between two objects or parts of an object to secure or separate them.
meanings.sent1: I used a wedge to keep the door open.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter hammered the wedge into the crack.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorn in the wedge of the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a wedge between the two friends.
meanings.sent5: The wedge of cheese was perfectly sliced for the party.

meanings.definition: To force into a narrow space.
meanings.sent1: She had to wedge her suitcase into the tight overhead compartment.
meanings.sent2: He tried to wedge the last piece of the puzzle into place.
meanings.sent3: The cat managed to wedge itself behind the couch and refused to come out.
meanings.sent4: The new regulations will wedge small businesses into a corner.
meanings.sent5: The heavy traffic wedge the cars together on the highway.

meanings.definition: A shape with a wide end and a pointed end.
meanings.sent1: The cake was decorated with a colorful wedge of watermelon.
meanings.sent2: She cut a small wedge of the pie for herself.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of a wedge in his hat.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak looked like a sharp wedge against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The paper airplane was folded into a perfect wedge shape.
